main event: A witness observed an unusually bright and swiftly moving object in the sky over Canaan, New Hampshire on January 14, 1968.
interesting points: The object moved in a straight line, leaving a sharply defined, evenly bright trail.
The light was described as brilliant, whiter than a welding arc, and unlike anything the witness had seen before.
The incident did not appear to be related to any known military activity in the area.
The witness carefully observed the object for 2-3 minutes before it disappeared from view.
The next day, the sky appeared normal.
sighted object: a bright, swiftly moving object in the sky
